thread.title: 8 things we learned as Mark Gatiss explored his Irish roots in Who Do You Think You Are?
thread.title_full: 8 things we learned as Mark Gatiss explored his Irish roots in Who Do You Think You Are?

title: 8 things we learned as Mark Gatiss explored his Irish roots in Who Do You Think You Are?
text:
Events 8 things we learned as Mark Gatiss explored his Irish roots in Who Do You Think You Are? 8 things we learned as Mark Gatiss explored his Irish roots in Who Do You Think You Are? 
Press Association 2014 / / National Entertainment News Share 
Mark Gatiss may be known for his fantasy storytelling and roles in The League of Gentlemen, Game of Thrones and Sherlock. 
But things turned quite interesting for the actor when he did some digging into his past on BBC’s Who Do You Think You Are? – and found a ‘supernatural’ connection. 
The actor was keen to learn more about his Irish roots on his mother’s side. Mark’s parents on their wedding day in 1957 (Wall To Wall Media/BBC) 
In his journey to uncover family history, the Sherlock actor found that royal blood really does run in his veins and that he may have descended from kings. But there were also some surprising tales that involved vampires and supernatural folklore. 
Here are a few things we know about Mark Gatiss now, thanks to WDYTYA. 
1. Mark gets his good looks from his great great grandfather Jeremiah O’Mullan. (BBC Screenshot) 
— WDYTYA? Magazine (@wdytyamagazine) October 8, 2015 @Markgatiss Jeremiah O Mullan looks like he's walked straight out of a Poe story.
